intro: Erigeron inornatus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron inornatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
